nodes.documentation:
@dev See {DAI-transfer}.
     * Requirements:
     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.
nodes.name: transfer
approve

nodes.documentation:
@dev See {DAI-transferFrom}.
     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not
required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {DAI};
     * Requirements:
- `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.
- the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least
`amount`.
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
@dev Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.
     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in {DAI-approve}.
     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.
     * Requirements:
     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: increaseAllowance

nodes.documentation:
@dev Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.
     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in {DAI-approve}.
     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.
     * Requirements:
     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
- `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least
`subtractedValue`.
nodes.name: decreaseAllowance

nodes.documentation:
@dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `msg.sender`, increasing
the total supply.
     * Requirements
     * - `msg.sender` must be the token owner
nodes.name: mint

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DAI: transfer from the zero address"

arguments.value: DAI: transfer from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DAI: transfer from the zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DAI: transfer to the zero address"

arguments.value: DAI: transfer to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DAI: transfer to the zero address"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves tokens `amount` from `sender` to `recipient`.
     * This is internal function is equivalent to {transfer}, and can be used to
e.g. implement automatic token fees, slashing mechanisms, etc.
     * Emits a {Transfer} event.
     * Requirements:
     * - `sender` cannot be the zero address.
- `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.
nodes.name: _transfer

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DAI: mint to the zero address"

arguments.value: DAI: mint to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DAI: mint to the zero address"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing
the total supply.
     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `from` set to the zero address.
     * Requirements
     * - `to` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: _mint

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DAI: burn from the zero address"

arguments.value: DAI: burn from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DAI: burn from the zero address"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, reducing the
total supply.
     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `to` set to the zero address.
     * Requirements
     * - `account` cannot be the zero address.
- `account` must have at least `amount` tokens.
nodes.name: _burn

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DAI: approve from the zero address"

arguments.value: DAI: approve from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DAI: approve from the zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DAI: approve to the zero address"

arguments.value: DAI: approve to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DAI: approve to the zero address"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the `owner`s tokens.
     * This is internal function is equivalent to `approve`, and can be used to
e.g. set automatic allowances for certain subsystems, etc.
     * Emits an {Approval} event.
     * Requirements:
     * - `owner` cannot be the zero address.
- `spender` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: _approve
_burnFrom

approve(address,uint256).details: See {DAI-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {DAI-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {DAI-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

mint(uint256).details: Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `msg.sender`, increasing the total supply.     * Requirements     * - `msg.sender` must be the token owner

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {DAI-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {DAI-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {DAI};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
